briefdescription.para: Perform Singular-Value decomposition on a rank-2 Tensor.

parameterdescription.para: a Tensor , it should be a rank-2 tensor (matrix)
if return a left uniform matrix.
if return a right uniform matrix.

simplesect.para:
[std::vector<Tensors>] 1. the first tensor is a 1-d tensor contanin the singular values 2. the second tensor is the left uniform matrix [U], a 2-d tensor (matrix). It only return when is_U=true.
the third tensor is the right uniform matrix [vT], a 2-d tensor (matrix). It only return when is_vT=true.

memberdef.name: Hosvd

briefdescription.para: Perform QR decomposition on a rank-2 Tensor.

parameterdescription.para: a Tensor , it should be a rank-2 tensor (matrix)
if return the tau that contains the Householder reflectors that generate q along with r. The tau array contains scaling factors for the reflectors

simplesect.para: [std::vector<Tensors>] 1. the first tensor is the orthomormal matrix [Q], a 2-d tensor (matrix) 2. the second tensor is the right-upper triangular matrix [R], a 2-d tensor (matrix). 3. the third tensor is the Householder reflectors [H], a 1-d tensor (vector). It only return when is_tau=true.

briefdescription.para: Perform QDR decomposition on a rank-2 Tensor.

parameterdescription.para: a Tensor , it should be a rank-2 tensor (matrix)
if return the tau that contains the Householder reflectors that generate q along with r. The tau array contains scaling factors for the reflectors

simplesect.para: [std::vector<Tensors>] 1. the first tensor is the orthomormal matrix [Q], a 2-d tensor (matrix) 2. the second tensor is the diagonal matrix [D], a 1-d tensor (matrix). 3. the third tensor is the right-upper triangular matrix [R], a 2-d tensor (matrix). 4. the forth tensor is the Householder reflectors [H], a 1-d tensor (matrix). It only return when is_tau=true.

briefdescription.para: Matrix inverse.

detaileddescription.para:
[Tensor]
[Note] the Tin should be a rank-2 Tensor.

briefdescription.para: inplace perform Matrix inverse.

detaileddescription.para: description: on return, the Tin will be modified to it's inverse.
[Note] the Tin should be a rank-2 Tensor.

briefdescription.para: Element-wise inverse with clip.

detaileddescription.para:
[Tensor]
description: Performs Elementwise inverse with clip. if A[i] < clip, then 1/A[i] = 0 will be set.
[Note] For complex type Tensors, the square norm is used to determine the clip.

briefdescription.para: inplace perform Element-wise inverse with clip.

detaileddescription.para:
[Tensor]
description:
Performs Elementwise inverse with clip. if A[i] < clip, then 1/A[i] = 0 will be set.
on return, all the elements will be modified to it's inverse. if Tin is integer type, it will automatically promote to Type.Double.
[Note] For complex type Tensors, the square norm is used to determine the clip.

briefdescription.para: Conjugate all the element in Tensor.

detaileddescription.para:
[Tensor]
[Note]
if the input Tensor is complex, then return a new Tensor with all the elements are conjugated.
if the input Tensor is real, then return a copy of input Tensor.

briefdescription.para: inplace perform Conjugate on all the element in Tensor.

detaileddescription.para:
[Note]
if the input Tensor is complex, the elements of input Tensor will all be conjugated.
if the input Tensor is real, then nothing act.

briefdescription.para: Exponential all the element in Tensor.
Exponential all the element in Tensor.
inplace perform Exponential on all the element in Tensor.

detaileddescription.para:
Tin the
input Tensor.
description:
on return, the elements in Tin will be modified to it's exponetial value.
For Real, if the type is not Double, change the type of the input tensor to Double.
For Complex, if input is ComplexFloat, promote to ComplexDouble.

briefdescription.para: inplace perform Exponential on all the element in Tensor.

input Tensor.
description:
on return, the elements in Tin will be modified to it's exponetial value.

For Complex, if input is ComplexDouble, promote to ComplexFloat.

briefdescription.para: perform tensor dot by sum out the indices assigned of two Tensors, with either one of them to be a rank-2 diagonal tensor represented by a rank-2 tensor.

detaileddescription.para:
Tl
Tensor #1
Tr
Tensor #2
idxl
the indices of rank of Tensor #1 that is going to sum with Tensor #2
idxr
the indices of rank of Tensor #2 that is going to sum with Tensor #1
diag_L
if Tl(true)/Tr(false) is a diagnal matrix, represented by a rank-1 tensor.

the elements in idxl and idxr have one to one correspondence.

briefdescription.para: perform outer produces of two rank-1 Tensor.

detaileddescription.para:
Tl
rank-1 Tensor #1
Tr
rank-1 Tensor #2
[Tensor]
description: if the Tensor #1 has [shape_1], and Tensor #2 has [shape_2]; then the return Tensor will have shape: concate(shape_1,shape_2)
[Note] two tensor should on same device.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Tensor &Tl, const Tensor &Tr, const bool &Tl_pad_left=false, const bool &Tr_pad_left=false)
memberdef.name: Kron

briefdescription.para: perform kronecker produces of two Tensor.

detaileddescription.para:
Tl
rank-n Tensor #1
Tr
rank-m Tensor #2
Tl_pad_left
The padding scheme for Tl if Tl.rank != Tr.rank
Tr_pad_left
The padding scheme for Tr if Tl.rank != Tr.rank
[Tensor]
description: The function assume two tensor has the same rank. In case where two tensors have different ranks, the small one will be extend by adding redundant dimension to the beginning of axis (T<x>_pad_right=true) or by adding redundant dim to the last axis (if T<x>_pad_left=false [default]). if the Tensor #1 has shape=(i1,j1,k1,l1...), and Tensor #2 has shape=(i2,j2,k2,l2...); then the return Tensor will have shape=(i1*i2,j1*j2,k1*k2...)
[Note] two tensor should on same device.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Tensor &T1, const Tensor &T2, const std::vector< cytnx_uint64 > &shared_axes)
memberdef.name: Directsum

briefdescription.para: perform directsum of two Tensor.

detaileddescription.para:
T1
rank-n Tensor #1
T2
rank-n Tensor #2
shared_axes
The axes that are shared by two tensors
[Tensor]
description: The function assume two tensor has the same rank, and axes indicated in <shared_axes> are the same for both T1 and T2. The out put tensors will have same rank as T1 and T2, with the dimension of rest of the axes being the sum of dimensions of T1 and T2. e.g., the out put shape = (i1+i2,j1+j2, share_axis_1, k1+k2, share_axis_2, ...); where T1.shape = (i1,j1,share_axis_1,k1,share_axis_2 ...) and T2.shape = (i2,j2,share_axis_1,k2,share_axis_2 ...)
[Note] two tensor should on same device.

briefdescription.para: perform inner product of vectors

detaileddescription.para:
Tl
Tensor #1
Tr
Tensor #2
if
the Tl should be conjugated (only work for complex. For real Tensor, no function), default: false
[Tensor] Rank-0
description: two Tensors must be Rank-1, with same length.
[Note] performance tune: This function have better performance when two vectors with same types, and are one of following type: cytnx_double, cytnx_float, cytnx_complex64 or cytnx_complex128.

briefdescription.para: dot product of two arrays.

detaileddescription.para:
Tl
Tensor #1
Tr
Tensor #2
[Tensor]
description:
if both Tl and Tr are 1d arrays, it is inner product of vectors (no complex conj), it calls linalg.Vectordot with is_conj=false.
if both Tl and Tr are 2d arrays, it calls linalg.Matmul to compute the matrix multiplication
if Tl is Nd array (with N>=2, and Tr is 1-D array, it is sum product over the last axis of a with b
[Note] performance tune: This function have better performance when two arrays with same types, and are one of following type: cytnx_double, cytnx_float, cytnx_complex64 or cytnx_complex128.
[Python] In Python API, operator@ is overloaded as a shorthand of linalg::Dot.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Tensor &Diag, const Tensor &Sub_diag, const bool &is_V=true, const bool &is_row=false, bool throw_excp=false)
memberdef.name: Tridiag

briefdescription.para: perform diagonalization of symmetric tri-diagnoal matrix.

detaileddescription.para:
Diag
Tensor #1
Sub_diag
Tensor #2
is_V
if calculate the eigen value.
k
Return k lowest eigen vector if is_V=True
throw_excp
Whether to throw exception when error occurs in Tridiag internal function
[vector<Tensor>] if is_V = True, the first tensor is the eigen value, and second tensor is eigenvector of shape [k,L].
description: two Tensors must be Rank-1, with length of Diag = L and Sub_diag length = L-1.

[Note] performance tune: This function have better performance when two vectors with same types, and are one of following type: cytnx_double, cytnx_float. In general all real type can be use as input, which will be promote to floating point type for calculation.

memberdef.name: Lanczos

briefdescription.para: perform Lanczos for hermitian/symmetric matrices or linear function.

parameterdescription.para: the Linear Operator defined by LinOp class or it's inheritance (see LinOp).
the initial vector, this should be rank-1.
the desired Lanczos method to use, can be 'ER' or 'Gnd'.
the convergence criterion of the energy.
the maximum interation steps for each k.
the number of lowest k eigen values.
if set to true, the eigen vectors will be returned.
whether the return eigen vectors should be in row-major form.
the maximum krylov subspace dimension for each iteration.
print out iteration info.

simplesect.para: [eigvals (Tensor), eigvecs (Tensor)(option)] #description: This function calculate the eigen value problem using explicitly restarted Lanczos. #Performance tune: For small linear dimension, try to reduce max_krydim. #[Note] To use, define a linear operator with LinOp class either by assign a custom function or create a class that inherit LinOp (see LinOp for further details)

memberdef.argsstring: (LinOp *Hop, const UniTensor &Tin=UniTensor(), const std::string method="Gnd", const double &CvgCrit=1.0e-14, const unsigned int &Maxiter=10000, const cytnx_uint64 &k=1, const bool &is_V=true, const bool &is_row=false, const cytnx_uint32 &max_krydim=4, const bool &verbose=false)

whether the return eigen vectors should be in row-major form.

print out iteration info.

briefdescription.para: Return the least-squares solution to a linear matrix equation.

detaileddescription.para:
A
Coefficient matrix, must be two-dimensional.
b
Ordinate or dependent variable values, must be two-dimensional, the least-squares solution is calculated for each of the K columns of b.
rcond
Cut-off ratio for small singular values of a. For the purposes of rank determination, singular values are treated as zero if they are smaller than rcond times the largest singular value of A, If it is negative, the machine precision is used.
[std::vector<Tensors>] 1. the first tensor is least-squares solutions in the K columns. 2. the second tensor is the sums of squared residuals: Squared Euclidean 2-norm for each column in b - a @ x. If the rank of a is < N or M <= N, this is a zero Tensor.
the third tensor is the rank of matrix A.
the forth tensor is singular values of A.
#description: Computes the vector x that approximatively solves the equation A @ x = b. The equation may be under-, well-, or over-determined independent columns. If a is square and of full rank, then x (but for round-off error) is the exact solution of the equation. Else, x minimizes the Euclidean 2-norm || b - a x ||.
[Ke]

briefdescription.para: Blas Axpy, performing return = a*x + y.

detaileddescription.para:
a
Scalar.
x
Tensor, can be any rank
y
Tensor, can be any rank
[Tensor]
#description: This function performs a*x+y where x,y are Tensor and a is a Scalar. The dtype of return Tensor will be the strongest among x,y and a.
If y is not specify, then it performs a*x -> return
#[Note] This will return a new tensor.

briefdescription.para: Blas Ger, performing return = a*vec(x)*vec(y)^T.

detaileddescription.para:
x
Tensor, rank-1 with size nx
y
Tensor, rank-1 with size ny
a
Scalar, if not provided a = 1.
[Tensor with shape (nx,ny)]
#description: This function performs a*x*y^T where x,y are rank-1 Tensor with dimension nx and ny respectively; and a is a Scalar. The dtype of return Tensor will be the strongest among x,y and a.
#[Note] This will return a new tensor.

briefdescription.para: linear algebra related functions.
